00028 Cleaner::Cleaner(State* state, const BuildConfig& config)
00029   : state_(state)
00030   , config_(config)
00031   , removed_()
00032   , cleaned_files_count_(0)
00033   , disk_interface_(new RealDiskInterface)
00034   , status_(0)
00035 {
00036 }
00037 
00038 Cleaner::Cleaner(State* state,
00039                  const BuildConfig& config,
00040                  DiskInterface* disk_interface)
00041   : state_(state)
00042   , config_(config)
00043   , removed_()
00044   , cleaned_files_count_(0)
00045   , disk_interface_(disk_interface)
00046   , status_(0)
00047 {
00048 }
00049 
00050 int Cleaner::RemoveFile(const string& path) {
00051   return disk_interface_->RemoveFile(path);
00052 }
00053 
00054 bool Cleaner::FileExists(const string& path) {
00055   return disk_interface_->Stat(path) > 0;
00056 }
00057 
00058 void Cleaner::Report(const string& path) {
00059   ++cleaned_files_count_;
00060   if (IsVerbose())
00061     printf("Remove %s\n", path.c_str());
00062 }
00063 
00064 void Cleaner::Remove(const string& path) {
00065   if (!IsAlreadyRemoved(path)) {
00066     removed_.insert(path);
00067     if (config_.dry_run) {
00068       if (FileExists(path))
00069         Report(path);
00070     } else {
00071       int ret = RemoveFile(path);
00072       if (ret == 0)
00073         Report(path);
00074       else if (ret == -1)
00075         status_ = 1;
00076     }
00077   }
00078 }
00079 
00080 bool Cleaner::IsAlreadyRemoved(const string& path) {
00081   set<string>::iterator i = removed_.find(path);
00082   return (i != removed_.end());
00083 }
00084 
00085 void Cleaner::PrintHeader() {
00086   if (config_.verbosity == BuildConfig::QUIET)
00087     return;
00088   printf("Cleaning...");
00089   if (IsVerbose())
00090     printf("\n");
00091   else
00092     printf(" ");
00093 }
00094 
00095 void Cleaner::PrintFooter() {
00096   if (config_.verbosity == BuildConfig::QUIET)
00097     return;
00098   printf("%d files.\n", cleaned_files_count_);
00099 }
00100 
00101 int Cleaner::CleanAll() {
00102   Reset();
00103   PrintHeader();
00104   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = state_->edges_.begin();
00105        e != state_->edges_.end();
00106        ++e)
00107     for (vector<Node*>::iterator out_node = (*e)->outputs_.begin();
00108          out_node != (*e)->outputs_.end();
00109          ++out_node)
00110       Remove((*out_node)->file_->path_);
00111   PrintFooter();
00112   return status_;
00113 }
00114 
00115 void Cleaner::DoCleanTarget(Node* target) {
00116   if (target->in_edge_) {
00117     Remove(target->file_->path_);
00118     for (vector<Node*>::iterator n = target->in_edge_->inputs_.begin();
00119          n != target->in_edge_->inputs_.end();
00120          ++n) {
00121       DoCleanTarget(*n);
00122     }
00123   }
00124 }
00125 
00126 int Cleaner::CleanTarget(Node* target) {
00127   assert(target);
00128 
00129   Reset();
00130   PrintHeader();
00131   DoCleanTarget(target);
00132   PrintFooter();
00133   return status_;
00134 }
00135 
00136 int Cleaner::CleanTarget(const char* target) {
00137   assert(target);
00138 
00139   Reset();
00140   Node* node = state_->LookupNode(target);
00141   if (node) {
00142     CleanTarget(node);
00143   } else {
00144     Error("unknown target '%s'", target);
00145     status_ = 1;
00146   }
00147   return status_;
00148 }
00149 
00150 int Cleaner::CleanTargets(int target_count, char* targets[]) {
00151   Reset();
00152   PrintHeader();
00153   for (int i = 0; i < target_count; ++i) {
00154     const char* target_name = targets[i];
00155     Node* target = state_->LookupNode(target_name);
00156     if (target) {
00157       if (IsVerbose())
00158         printf("Target %s\n", target_name);
00159       DoCleanTarget(target);
00160     } else {
00161       Error("unknown target '%s'", target_name);
00162       status_ = 1;
00163     }
00164   }
00165   PrintFooter();
00166   return status_;
00167 }
00168 
00169 void Cleaner::DoCleanRule(const Rule* rule) {
00170   assert(rule);
00171 
00172   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = state_->edges_.begin();
00173        e != state_->edges_.end();
00174        ++e)
00175     if ((*e)->rule_->name_ == rule->name_)
00176       for (vector<Node*>::iterator out_node = (*e)->outputs_.begin();
00177            out_node != (*e)->outputs_.end();
00178            ++out_node)
00179         Remove((*out_node)->file_->path_);
00180 }
00181 
00182 int Cleaner::CleanRule(const Rule* rule) {
00183   assert(rule);
00184 
00185   Reset();
00186   PrintHeader();
00187   DoCleanRule(rule);
00188   PrintFooter();
00189   return status_;
00190 }
00191 
00192 int Cleaner::CleanRule(const char* rule) {
00193   assert(rule);
00194 
00195   Reset();
00196   const Rule* r = state_->LookupRule(rule);
00197   if (r) {
00198     CleanRule(r);
00199   } else {
00200     Error("unknown rule '%s'", rule);
00201     status_ = 1;
00202   }
00203   return status_;
00204 }
00205 
00206 int Cleaner::CleanRules(int rule_count, char* rules[]) {
00207   assert(rules);
00208 
00209   Reset();
00210   PrintHeader();
00211   for (int i = 0; i < rule_count; ++i) {
00212     const char* rule_name = rules[i];
00213     const Rule* rule = state_->LookupRule(rule_name);
00214     if (rule) {
00215       if (IsVerbose())
00216         printf("Rule %s\n", rule_name);
00217       DoCleanRule(rule);
00218     } else {
00219       Error("unknown rule '%s'", rule_name);
00220       status_ = 1;
00221     }
00222   }
00223   PrintFooter();
00224   return status_;
00225 }
00226 
00227 void Cleaner::Reset() {
00228   status_ = 0;
00229   cleaned_files_count_ = 0;
00230   removed_.clear();
00231 }
